p: Propolis samples had a composition resembling a mixture of substances characteristic of aspen (phenolic acid glycerides) or poplar (flavonoids) (18 samples) or exhibited profile similar to P. nigra (three samples: Polish, German and Canadian propolis). The most common black poplar components in propolis include flavonoids chrysine, pinocembrine and pinobanksin-3- O-acetate [ 3, 4, 5, 9]. Among the various phenolic acid glycerides, a higher concentration was observed for 2-acetyl-1,3-di- p-coumaroylglycerol. Some substances showed bigger peaks in propolis ( p-coumaric acid benzyl ester) and some in its plant sources (pinostrobin chalcone). This apparent discrepancy in concentration could however be explained.
